semantic_title: Diabetes Mellitus in Pregnancy Coding Guidelines
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Chapter 15: Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > g. Diabetes mellitus in pregnancy

content.full_text: Diabetes mellitus is a significant complicating factor in pregnancy. Pregnant patients who are diabetic should be assigned a code from category O24, (Evidence: pg no: 66, L95-L96)
content.summary: Introduction to diabetes mellitus coding in pregnancy using category O24 (Evidence: pg no: 66, L95-L96)
key_concepts: Diabetes as significant pregnancy complication (Evidence: pg no: 66, L95)
O24 category requirement (Evidence: pg no: 66, L96)
Diabetic pregnancy coding (Evidence: pg no: 66, L95-L96)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign O24 category codes for diabetic pregnant patients (Evidence: pg no: 66, L95-L96)
detailed_rules.explanation: All pregnant patients with diabetes should receive a code from category O24 regardless of diabetes type (Evidence: pg no: 66, L95-L96)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify diabetes in pregnant patient
Step 2: Determine type of diabetes (pre-existing vs gestational)
Step 3: Assign appropriate O24 code based on diabetes type and trimester

code_ranges.description: Diabetes mellitus in pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium (Evidence: pg no: 66, L96)
code_ranges.requirement: Required for all diabetic pregnant patients
usage_rules: Use for all types of diabetes in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 66, L95-L96)

references_to.title: Pre-existing conditions versus conditions due to the pregnancy
references_to.explanation: Diabetes coding applies pre-existing vs gestational distinction

coding_scenarios.scenario: Type 1 diabetic patient at 24 weeks gestation for routine prenatal visit
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: 24-week prenatal visit, patient with Type 1 diabetes diagnosed 10 years ago, well controlled on insulin
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify Type 1 diabetes in pregnant patient
Step 3: Assign O24.012 for pre-existing Type 1 diabetes, second trimester

correct_coding.rationale: Diabetic pregnant patients require O24 category codes (Evidence: pg no: 66, L95-L96)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should use O24 code for diabetes in pregnancy, not just diabetes code
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using only diabetes code without pregnancy-specific O24 code

warnings: All diabetic pregnant patients need O24 codes (Evidence: pg no: 66, L95-L96)
best_practices: Always use O24 category for diabetes in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 66, L95-L96)
Distinguish between pre-existing and gestational diabetes
Include appropriate trimester in code selection
common_mistakes: Using only diabetes codes without O24 codes
Not recognizing diabetes as pregnancy complication
tips: Diabetes is always significant in pregnancy
O24 codes are mandatory for diabetic pregnant patients
implementation_notes: Requires knowledge of diabetes types and pregnancy coding
May need additional diabetes codes as secondary
